comment: He is a nice man, but a tough grader. While earning A's in other difficult classes, I had a C this entire course until the end when he curved the final. No matter how much effort I put into the assignments, nothing was good enough to get above a C. If you have a question, good luck getting a helpful answer. Avoid if you can.

Dr. Kabir is a bit too dismissive of his students and their questions. After talking with other students taking 1211L with different professors, it appears that the class itself wasn't hard- just this professor. He never told us how to prepare for the final at all. His responses to emails are extremely vague and never help. Quite rude responses.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Not the best, but not the worse. Just be aware if you take him that he does grade a little harder than most
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I dropped this class because the prof, along with the prof for the associated lecture, was so terrible at answering questions and actually giving instruction. I and others would ask questions and he would give totally useless answers; he didn't seem to even understand the question asked. Do yourself a favor and pick someone else.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had Dr. Kabir for Chem1212L. First of all, he is not specific on grading criteria for the lab reports. He just marks off randomly on your papers with his red pen accompanied by a few remarks in his illegible handwriting. He does NOT tell you how to improve or what was done incorrectly. He barely explains the labs, but still talks A LOT. Good luck

50% of the grade comes from lab reports so you have to make sure to do the lab correctly and know the material. Lectures a lot before the lab but very helpful during the lab and they're all pretty easy and straightforward. Most of the lab reports are easy and he's a fair grader. He isn't as bad as the other reviews make him sound.

Talks a lot and lectures a lot during lab. The lab was a week ahead of lecture so the material was a lot harder and more complicated. He grades fairly and is overall pretty nice and willing to help you out but he can be confusing at times. The lab final was rough. If you can take someone else.

Dont let the A I earned in this class fool you! While Dr. Kabir is knowledgeable, he is a tough professor. Lab reports should be impeccable to even earn the chance at obtaining an A. He often would often answer our questions wrong or not indicate how to properly complete the labs until after the fact, little by little, week by week. Avoid!

I would for sure pick another lab professor. This man takes difficulty to a whole other level. Me and my friend worked on final lab submissions together and her professor would give her A's on everything while I would get B's or C's even D's on final lab submissions. I got a B and I had to work extra hard for that so good luck.

Dr. Kabir is honestly a hit or miss depending on the person. His grading is very difficult. He's a nice guy and funny. You will have fun in his class, but you will spend hours on labs to get good grades. He drops one grade per category and I got an A when I know I should've gotten a B so idk. He curved the final as well and cares about your grade.

Dr. Kabir is very knowledgable about organic chemistry. The labs itself are pretty self explanatory, and he is always ready to help and answer questions. He gives a lecture before you start the lab to give some background information. He is an easy grader on the labs, the quizzes are a bit difficult but if you study the labs you will do fine.
Stay away. All A's right now in the semester but I am fighting for a B in his class. Nothing makes sense and we are currently ahead of our lecture so we have no idea what is going in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you want even a fair shot at PASSING lab, don't take him. He is the worst prof I've had. I had to drop because I was failing (like everyone else in the class) and couldn't risk losing my 4.0 or scholarship over ONE lab. Super hard to understand, gives no direction at all, thinks he knows EVERYTHING but can't do simple sig figs. Waste of time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: His class is extremely difficult no matter how much of the answer he wants its never enough and he does the most.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I took this class with chemistry and it has been THE hardest class I have ever attended. I am taking 13 credit hour and other than Dr. Kabirs lab I have all A+. I work at LEAST 8 hours a week on his class trying to perfect every little detail and I still have a F in his class. You can not understand stand him in class or what hes talking about.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
